doc:
Swen Swenson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swen_Swenson 0 Swen Swenson (January 23, 1930 - June 23, 1993) was a Broadway dancer and singer. Born in Inwood, Iowa, Swenson was trained by dancer Mira Rostova and at the School of American Ballet. Openly gay, he had featured and co-starring roles on Broadway in such musicals such as Wildcat with Lucille Ball, Little Me (for which he received a Tony Award nomination), Annie, No, No Nanette, I Remember Mama and the 1981 revival of Can-Can. He appeared in movies and on television variety shows, including Your Show of Shows and The Ed Sullivan Show. Swenson died in 1993 of AIDS-related illness. Swen_Swenson ( January_23_,_1930 - June_23_,_1993 ) was a_Broadway_dancer_and_singer . Born in Inwood , Iowa , Swenson was_trained by dancer_Mira_Rostova and at the_School of American_Ballet . Openly_gay , he had_featured and co-starring roles on Broadway in such_musicals such_as Wildcat with Lucille_Ball , Little_Me_( for which he received a_Tony_Award_nomination_)_,_Annie_,_No_,_No_Nanette , I Remember Mama and the_1981_revival of Can-Can . He appeared in movies and on television_variety_shows , including Your_Show of Shows and The_Ed_Sullivan_Show . Swenson died in 1993 of AIDS-related_illness .
